chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
l: lb

Goal:
⟦ lb_shift n l ⟧ = ⟦ l ⟧ * power n 2

Premises:
lb_shift = fun (n : nat) (l : lb) => lb_bots n ++ l : nat -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_shift _%nat_scope _%list_scope
Notation power := (mscal mul 1)
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Notation lb := (list bool)
lb_nat_app : forall l m : lb, ⟦ l ++ m ⟧ = ⟦ l ⟧ + power (length l) 2 * ⟦ m ⟧
lb_nat_fix_1 : forall l : lb, ⟦ ⟘ :: l ⟧ = 2 * ⟦ l ⟧
lb_nat_fix_2 : forall l : lb, ⟦ ⟙ :: l ⟧ = 1 + 2 * ⟦ l ⟧
lb_nat_fix_3 : forall (x : bool) (l : lb), ⟦ x :: l ⟧ = bool2nat x + 2 * ⟦ l ⟧
lb_plus_spec_0 : forall l m : lb, ⟦ l ⊕ m ⟧ = ⟦ l ⟧ + ⟦ m ⟧
lb_succ_spec_0 : forall l : lb, ⟦ lb_succ ⟘ l ⟧ = ⟦ l ⟧
lb_succ_spec_1 : forall l : lb, ⟦ lb_succ ⟙ l ⟧ = S ⟦ l ⟧
lb_mask_equiv_equal : forall l m : lb, l ≂ m < -> ⟦ l ⟧ = ⟦ m ⟧
lb_plus_spec : forall (a : bool) (l m : lb), ⟦ lb_plus a l m ⟧ = bool2nat a + ⟦ l ⟧ + ⟦ m ⟧
lb_succ_spec : forall (a : bool) (l : lb), ⟦ lb_succ a l ⟧ = bool2nat a + ⟦ l ⟧
lb_mask_eq_binary_le : forall l m : lb, l ⪯ m < -> ⟦ l ⟧ ≲ ⟦ m ⟧
lb_mask_binary_le : forall l m : lb, l ⪯ m -> ⟦ l ⟧ ≲ ⟦ m ⟧
lb_nat_eq_Proper = fun (x y : lb) (H : x ≂ y) => (let H0 : forall l m : lb, l ≂ m -> ⟦ l ⟧ = ⟦ m ⟧ := fun l m : lb => match lb_mask_equiv_equal l m with | conj x0 _ => x0 end in H0) x y H : Morphisms.Proper (lb_mask_equiv ==> eq) lb_nat Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_nat_eq_Proper : forall [x y : lb], x ≂ y -> ⟦ x ⟧ = ⟦ y ⟧ Arguments lb_nat_eq_Proper [x y]
nat_lb_nat : forall l : lb, ⟬ ⟦ l ⟧ ⟭ ≂ l
lb_mask_nat : forall l : lb, ⟬ ⟦ l ⟧ ⟭ ≂ l
lb_nat_eq : forall x y : lb, x ≂ y -> ⟦ x ⟧ = ⟦ y ⟧
lb_nat_fix_0 = eq_refl : ⟦ nil ⟧ = 0
lb_nat_lb : forall n : nat, ⟦ ⟬ n ⟭ ⟧ = n
lb_shift_S : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), lb_shift (S n) l = ⟘ :: lb_shift n l
lb_shift_0 : forall l : lb, lb_shift 0 l = l
sum_2_power_2_injective : forall i1 j1 i2 j2 : nat, j1 <= i1 -> j2 <= i2 -> power i1 2 + power j1 2 = power i2 2 + power j2 2 -> i1 = i2 /\ j1 = j2
prime.expand_app : forall (p : nat) (l m : list nat), prime.expand p (l ++ m) = prime.expand p l + power (length l) p * prime.expand p m
power_2_inj : forall i j : nat, power i 2 = power j 2 -> i = j
euclid_2 : forall n : nat, exists q : nat, n = 2 * q \/ n = 1 + 2 * q
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
lb_nat = fix lb_nat (l : lb) : nat := match l with | nil => 0 | x :: l0 => bool2nat x + 2 * lb_nat l0 end : lb -> nat Arguments lb_nat _%list_scope
lb_mask_equiv = fun l m : lb => l ⪯ m /\ m ⪯ l : lb -> lb -> Prop Arguments lb_mask_equiv (_ _)%list_scope
lb_plus_fix_1 : forall (a : bool) (l : lb), lb_plus a l nil = lb_succ a l
lb_plus_fix_0 : forall (a : bool) (l : lb), lb_plus a nil l = lb_succ a l
power_S : forall n x : nat, power (S n) x = x * power n x
div_2_bool2nat : forall (b : bool) (n : nat), div (bool2nat b + 2 * n) 2 = n
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
power_decomp_factor : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> forall (n : nat) (f a : nat -> nat), (forall i : nat, 0 < i < S n -> f 0 < f i) -> ∑ (S n) (fun i : nat => a i * power (f i) p) = ∑ n (fun i : nat => a (S i) * power (f (S i) - f 0 - 1) p) * power (S (f 0)) p + a 0 * power (f 0) p
Newton_nat : forall a b n : nat, power n (a + b) = ∑ (S n) (fun i : nat => binomial.binomial n i * power (n - i) a * power i b)
prime.is_rel_prime_mult : forall p q l : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> is_gcd p l 1 -> is_gcd p (q * l) 1
nat_lb_fix_2 : forall n : nat, ⟬ 1 + 2 * n ⟭ = ⟙ :: ⟬ n ⟭
power2_gt_0 : forall n : nat, 0 < power n 2
nat_lb_fix_1 : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> ⟬ 2 * n ⟭ = ⟘ :: ⟬ n ⟭
in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil
Newton_nat_S : forall a n : nat, power n (1 + a) = ∑ (S n) (fun i : nat => binomial.binomial n i * power i a)

```  
induction n.
- simpl. rewrite lb_nat_fix_0. simpl. ring.
- simpl lb_shift. rewrite lb_shift_S. simpl. rewrite IHn. rewrite lb_nat_fix_1. rewrite lb_nat_fix_0. ring.
```
